content:
Where in the settings can I change the way recent topics widget is launched? I am a member of two organisations hosted on ofc. zulip server and the recent topics is launched in different way:
Screenshot_2020-07-24_09-57-36.png Screenshot_2020-07-24_10-00-05.png
I looked for the answer in the settings but I was not able to find it.

@Bartlomiej P there is no setting for this; chat.zulip.org is our development community, and we're testing here the change to make it launched not as a modal (for everyone) as has always been the plan.
Is your preference the modal version or the other one? I'd appreciate your feedback.
@Tim Abbott I started to use recent topics today so as for now I like the pop-up approach better and here is why:
I read some topic in the stream and with t I can get pop-up with recent-topics which can be closed with esc and I am back with my topic I was reading before
after upgrade to 3.0 which variant is shipped as default?

Bartlomiej P said:

I read some topic in the stream and with t I can get pop-up with recent-topics which can be closed with esc and I am back with my topic I was reading before

with the other approach after hitting esc I am moved to all messages and that might be annoying
You can use Back (Alt+Left on the keyboard) to get back to something after visiting "Recent Topics" in both places.
Right, well the plan is to make Esc take you to Recent topics, not All Messages.

Tim Abbott said:

You can use Back (Alt+Left on the keyboard) to get back to something after visiting "Recent Topics" in both places.

I did not know that, thank you for the tip

Tim Abbott said:

Right, well the plan is to make Esc take you to Recent topics, not All Messages.

I plan to upgrade to 3.0 today so I can try take a feedback from our users after a week or so
at least one of my colleages use all messages as main screen for catching up with messages so I hope that feature wont be forgotten :)
Yeah, we're not removing it, just changing the Esc behavior.
well with having ability to go back with alt-left I might rethink my opinion about pop-up , I will post feedback after some time with 3.0 version
